docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 26--Among the numerous activities of North Americans here, whether private or Government sponsored, there is one that stands out by virtue of the unanimous approval it appears to inspire among Mexicans.
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 26--Among the numerous activities of North Americans here, whether private or Government sponsored, there is one that stands out by virtue of the unanimous approval it appears to inspire among Mexicans.
docs.abstract: State Dept may assume control; Dir Bentley opposes shift; sees standing threatened

headline.main: LIBRARY IN MEXICO NOW STORM FOCUS; U.S. Embassy May Take Over Cultural Center--Director Fears Recoil of Opinion

byline.original: By VIRGINIA LEE WARREN Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Maritime Commission has approved contracts for reconditioning and reconversion of three merchant vessels, the passenger liner Argentina and the cargo carriers Kenneth McKay, and Sue Lykes, it was learned yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Maritime Commission has approved contracts for reconditioning and reconversion of three merchant vessels, the passenger liner Argentina and the cargo carriers Kenneth McKay, and Sue Lykes, it was learned yesterday.
docs.abstract: Maritime Comm halts voyages pending US State Dept decision on ship return to Italy

headline.main: THREE SHIPS READY FOR RECONVERSION; Maritime Agency Approves the Contracts for the Argentina, Kenneth McKay, Sue Lykes

docs.snippet: Few who watch the quietly efficient batteries of United Nations verbatim reporters and their typists at work realize the frantic search that was made to get then together to cover the greatest parliament in history.
docs.lead_paragraph: Few who watch the quietly efficient batteries of United Nations verbatim reporters and their typists at work realize the frantic search that was made to get then together to cover the greatest parliament in history.
docs.abstract: Need for shorthand reporters noted; role of verbatim staff discussed

headline.main: U.N. SHORTHANDED IN SHORTHAND PIT; Verbatim Staff Seldom Errs, but Sound Record Is Kept, Just in Case

docs.snippet: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 29--The proposal of the Atlas Corporation to purchase the building at 37-39 West Fifty-seventh Street. New York City, from the Liberty Magazine Company, Inc., for $1,125,000, was approved today by the Securities and Exchange...
docs.lead_paragraph: PHILADELPHIA, Oct. 29--The proposal of the Atlas Corporation to purchase the building at 37-39 West Fifty-seventh Street. New York City, from the Liberty Magazine Company, Inc., for $1,125,000, was approved today by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

headline.main: ATLAS CORP. DEAL APPROVED BY SEC; $1,125,000 for Building of Liberty Magazine Found to Be Fair Price

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: The Soviet Union's four-point proposal for a world-wide reduction in armaments will come up before the General Assembly's fourteen-nation general committee when it meets at 10 A. M. today.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Soviet Union's four-point proposal for a world-wide reduction in armaments will come up before the General Assembly's fourteen-nation general committee when it meets at 10 A. M. today.
docs.abstract: UN Assembly gen com to study USSR proposal

headline.main: COMMITTEE OF U.N. TO STUDY ARMS PLAN

headline.main: GIRL REGULAR U.N. GUEST; Daughter of Uruguayan Envoy Follows Affairs Closely

docs.snippet: The Mormacisle, the first MooreMcCormack ship to clear port since the end of the maritime strike, left yesterday with a capacity cargo and Albert V. Moore, president of Moore-McCormack Lines, and his wife aboard as passengers.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mormacisle, the first MooreMcCormack ship to clear port since the end of the maritime strike, left yesterday with a capacity cargo and Albert V. Moore, president of Moore-McCormack Lines, and his wife aboard as passengers.
docs.abstract: SS Mormacisle sails for S Amer with pres and wife aboard; VP and wife set to sail aboard SS Monnacmoon for Scandinavia; both officials plan trade surveys; shipping plans noted

headline.main: SHIPPING OFFICIALS TO SURVEY TRADE; A.V. Moore Sails to Study South America--W.T. Moore to Visit Scandinavia
